title.narrative: Provision of health services and assistance to isolation centers in Al Hol camp and Al Areesha camp in Hassakeh province.

description.narrative:
The camps are more vulnerable to the transmission of COVED-19 due to the overcrowding of the displaced people in the camps and lack of protective supplies and tools and shortage of the curative health services. So that, the need to provision of the curative services to the residents of the camp is the priority, thus WHO established isolation centers in Al Hol, Al Areesha camps, to provide curative services for the infected moderate cases of COVID-19 where the other potential acute levels of COVID-19 will be referred out the camps for advanced level of treatment at Damascus level. the project will contribute to provide the necessary requirements of medical, protective supplies and medicines as well the logistical services and well provision of the medical staff that needed to facilitate the provision of the treatment for the potential infected cases at the isolation centers in the camps. the curative services provided at the isolation centers will be linked with the other health partners in close coordination with WHO.
- As of the date of the field assessment, Al Hol camp, direct beneficiaries, reads 18,100 families of 65,705 persons of which 6,940 of displaced families of 25,125 persons and 2,851 foreigner women headed of families (migrants) and 8,304 Iraqi refugee families of 30,735 persons. where Al Areesha camp holds 2,500 displaced families of 15,000 people. As a total in both camps, the direct beneficiaries reads 20,600 families of displaced and refugee families of 80,705 people.
